thread.title: Girl inappropriately touched by passenger on flight sues American Airlines
thread.title_full: Girl inappropriately touched by passenger on flight sues American Airlines | News24

author: news24.com
title: Girl inappropriately touched by passenger on flight sues American Airlines
text:
Des Moines - The parents of a girl who reported being inappropriately touched by a man while flying alone from New York to Iowa have sued the man and American Airlines, saying the airline failed to protect the girl.
Muhammad Asif Chaudhry, aged 57, was arrested after the July flight on charges including engaging in sexual contact with a victim between the ages of 12 and 16. The Pakistani citizen, who has denied the accusations, has since been released on bond.
The lawsuit alleges that Chaudhry moved to an open seat beside the girl. The girl texted her mother, who had just arrived at work in Iowa, saying she was woken up by a man inappropriately touching her with his foot and later his hand.
'Mommy I'm scared'
